result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Williams

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Michael Williams not in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Michael Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22CM592 Br. 4)  Case called at 5:03 p.m.  Atty. Drewa states the defendant called him and advised was on the way to court and vehicle broke down and was waiting for a tow truck.  Defendant is requesting a one month adjournment as defendant needs to take road test again.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Michael Williams in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Michael Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22CM592 Br. 4)  Atty. Drewa states defendant is taking road test this week.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Michael Williams in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. (22CM592 Br. 4)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $100.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
